Class Component

java.lang.Object
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component
Direct Known Subclasses:
Battery, Lightbulb, Switch, Wire
public abstract class Component extends Object
Abstract base class for all circuit components in the simulator. Components can include batteries, lightbulbs, switches, wires, etc. Each component can have an associated ImageView for its visual representation, voltage values for simulation, and one or more Port connections to other components. Subclasses must implement simulation logic, power checks, and port management.

  • Constructor Details

    • Component

      public Component(javafx.scene.image.ImageView view)
      Constructs a new Component with an optional image view.
      Parameters:
      view - The ImageView representing the component, may be null.

  • Method Details

    • getView

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getView()
      Gets the image view representing this component.
      Returns:
      the image view or null if not applicable

    • getVoltage

      public double getVoltage()
      Gets the current voltage level for this component.
      Returns:
      the voltage in volts

    • setVoltage

      public void setVoltage(double voltage)
      Sets the voltage level for this component.
      Parameters:
      voltage - the voltage in volts

    • simulate

      public abstract void simulate()
      Runs the component’s internal simulation logic. This may include voltage propagation and interaction with connected components.

    • getPorts

      public abstract List<Port> getPorts()
      Returns the list of ports that belong to this component.
      Returns:
      a list of Port objects

    • isPowered

      public abstract boolean isPowered()
      Indicates whether this component is currently powered (e.g., receiving voltage).
      Returns:
      true if powered, false otherwise

    • propagatePower

      public void propagatePower()
      Begins recursive propagation of power signals from this component. Uses a default empty visited set to track visited components.

    • propagatePower

      public abstract void propagatePower(Set<Component> visited)
      Propagates power through the circuit starting from this component. Avoids cycles by using a visited set.
      Parameters:
      visited - the set of components already visited

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares by identity rather than state. Components are only equal if they are the same instance.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare
      Returns:
      true if the objects are the same instance

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Hash code based on object identity.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      identity-based hash code

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets all voltage-related state for this component and its ports.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects this component from all its connected ports. Clears connections and voltage propagation.

    • updateVisualState

      public void updateVisualState()
      Updates the visual state of the component. Default implementation does nothing. Override in subclasses.
